entry.title: How Ads Work on YouTube: Videos, Shorts & Live

media:group.media:title: How Ads Work on YouTube: Videos, Shorts & Live
media:group.media:description:
If you’re an eligible creator in the YouTube Partner Program, Ads are one of the many ways you can earn revenue from your videos, Shorts, and live streams. In this video, we’ll walk through a bit about advertiser-friendly guidelines, and how to enable and manage ads on YouTube.
For more info, check out these articles: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/12929256 https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/2467968 https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/7438625 https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/2467968 https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/6332943 https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/6162278
00:00 Ads on YouTube 00:17 Advertiser- friendly guidelines 01:11 How Ads Work for Videos 03:35 How Ads Work on Shorts 04:23 How Ads Work on Live Streams
Subscribe and hit the bell to see new videos: https://goo.gl/So4XIG

entry.title: How to Create on YouTube: Videos, Shorts, Mobile Live Streaming, & Posts from your phone

media:group.media:title: How to Create on YouTube: Videos, Shorts, Mobile Live Streaming, & Posts from your phone
media:group.media:description:
In this video, we’ll show you how to upload videos, create Shorts, live stream, and post to YouTube using the YouTube Mobile Main app. When you tap the Create (+) icon in the bottom of the YouTube app, you’ll see all these different options. You can swipe through them to create in the format you want.
For more info, check out these articles: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/57407 https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/10343433 https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/9228390 https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/7124474

entry.title: YouTube Partner Program: How to Make Money on YouTube

media:group.media:title: YouTube Partner Program: How to Make Money on YouTube
media:group.media:description:
The YouTube Partner Program (YPP) offers more ways to make money from your content and community than anywhere else. We'll walk through how to qualify, apply and get approved, and what features become available to you once you’re in - like Channel Memberships, Super Chat, Super Stickers, Super Thanks, YouTube Shopping, Advertising Revenue, and Premium Revenue.
For more info, check out these resources: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/72851 https://support.google.com/youtube/topic/9153567 https://support.google.com/youtube/topic/9240125 https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/72857 https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/94522 https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/13429240

entry.title: Edit Your Videos with the YouTube Create App🎬🎞️🙌

media:group.media:title: Edit Your Videos with the YouTube Create App🎬🎞️🙌
media:group.media:description:
The YouTube Create app lets you easily edit videos and Shorts right from your phone. No matter how simple or complex your ideas are, YouTube Create lets you bring them to life - completely free of charge. For more info and to download the app, check out the links below!
Download the YouTube Create App here: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.google.android.apps.youtube.producer
For more info on the YouTube Create App check out these resources: https://support.google.com/youtube/topic/13521391

media:group.media:title: ✨NEW✨ Add LINKS🔗 in your SHORTS🩳
media:group.media:description: Shorts can now link viewers to more of your content – whether it's your latest video, another Short, or live stream! To direct viewers to your other content from your Short, use the “Related Video” feature. Once you finish uploading your Short, open YouTube Studio on desktop, then go to “Content”. Click the details icon for your Short. Then find “Related Video”. Click the edit icon to add a link to the piece of content you want to direct viewers to. Make sure the content you link to is public or unlisted, and from the same channel as your Short. Then Save. Your Short will now have a link your viewers can easily tap within the Shorts player. Try it out! And subscribe to the YouTube Creators Channel for more Shorts tips and updates!

media:group.media:title: NEW: YouTube Community Guidelines System
media:group.media:description:
YouTube’s Community Guidelines outline what type of content is and isn’t allowed on YouTube. Starting today, creators will have the option of taking a specialized training course when they receive a Community Guidelines warning. Completion of the course will remove the warning from a creator’s channel — so long as they don’t violate the same policy for 90 days. And, while creators were previously given one warning throughout the lifetime of their channel, they’ll now get individual warnings depending on the specific policy they violate if they take the trainings. This means more opportunities to learn why their content may have crossed the line, and the ability to take multiple learning courses at the same time. We believe this update will help the vast majority of creators produce content that complies with our policies, and help keep YouTube a safe and responsible platform for everyone.
For more information about YouTube Community Guidelines, check out these resources: https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/9288567 https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/2802032 https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/9235777
Subscribe and hit the bell to see new videos: https://goo.gl/So4XIG
